memberdef.argsstring: (const Integrand &integrand, const double vmin, const double vmax) -> Q
memberdef.name: asymp_corrections_bubble_via_quadrature

detaileddescription.para: Possible unit-tests: compare with quadrature routines for (semi-)infinite intervals

memberdef.argsstring: (K_class k, const vertexType_1 &vertex1, const vertexType_2 &vertex2, const Propagator< Q > &G, double vmin, double vmax, freqType w, freqType v, freqType vp, int i0_in, int i2, int i_in, bool diff) -> Q
memberdef.name: asymp_corrections_bubble

detaileddescription.para: Compute the analytical result for the asymptotic tails of the bubble integral, assuming the self-energy to be decayed to the Hartree value. The full result is Gamma_L * I_tails(vmin, vmax) * Gamma_R, where vmax/vmin are the upper/lower limits of the numerically evaluated integral, I_tails is the channel-dependent helper function defined above, containing the result of the analytical integration, and Gamma_L, Gamma_R are the left/right vertices, with appropriately chosen arguments.

parameterdescription.para: : Symmetry type of the left vertex
: Symmetry type of the right vertex
: Diagrammatic class (k1, k2, k3) to which the result contributes
: Bubble propagator (needed for the Hartree selfenergy and the flow parameter Lambda)
: Lower limit of the numerically evaluated integral in bubble_function
: Upper limit of the numerically evaluated integral in bubble_function
: External fermionic frequency (only needed for K2, K3)
: External fermionic frequency (only needed for K3)
: External Keldysh index input. Must be converted to iK in 0...15

memberdef.argsstring: (const vertexType &vertex, const Propagator< Q > &G, double vmin, double vmax, double v, int iK, int ispin, int i_in, const bool all_spins) -> Q
memberdef.name: asymp_corrections_loop

detaileddescription.para:
Compute the analytical result for the asymptotic tails of the loop integral, assuming the self-energy of the propagator to be decayed to the Hartree value. The full result is (Gamma_0 + K1t(w = 0) + K2't(w = 0, v' = v)) * I_tails(vmin, vmax), where vmax/vmin are the upper/lower limits of the numerically evaluated integral, I_tails is the loop integral helper function defined above, containing the result of the analytical integration, and Gamma_0 is the bare vertex.
vertex
: Vertex in the loop
G
: Loop propagator
vmin
: Lower limit of the numerically evaluated integral in loop(...)
vmax
: Upper limit of the numerically evaluated integral in loop(...)
v
: External fermionic frequency
iK
: Keldysh index of the result (0: retarded component, 1: Keldysh component)
i_in
: Internal index
all_spins
: Determines if spin sum in loop is performed.
